name: Automated functional tests
description: Using behat, phantom js, headless chome and jenkins

name: Infrastructure as code
description: We standardized around Terraform for all our Infrastructure providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)

name: Standardized code reviews
description: Although most of our projects are covered by code reviews, having a standardized reviewing process (aggregating from the best practices across all our projects) will allow us to improve the quality of the development process and deliver a consistent experience to our customers. Detailed reasoning in internal decision record ZDR-0002.

name: Ansible
description: Ansible's role has been significantly diminished and will no longer be used for config management at the VM level (given that most projects now run on Kubernetes). However, we will keep using Ansible to deploy certain Helm charts inside Kubernetes clusters.

name: Varnish
description: Will be used mainly on Magento projects

name: PowerBI
description: PowerBI is a business analytics tool that provides interactive visualizations and BI capabilities with an interface that is easy to use for creating reports and dashboards. We like PowerBI because it supports a large number of data sources and offers a significant number of highly customizable reports and dashboards. We also like its ability to connect directly to data sources through DirectQuery. We will be using PowerBI for all our BI needs when the data warehouse/data source is in Azure.

name: GitHub Copilot
description: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered code assistant that promises to automate repetitive code writing tasks, while also being able to generate small blocks of code based on context. Although we feel like using Copilot incurs some extra debugging time, the experience seems to be net positive and we're inclined to recommend its adoption at the company level given the reasonable pricing. Adoption progress documented in internal decision record ZDR-0005.

name: AWS Code Deploy
description: Given that we standardized the code deployment process around Kubernetes + GitLab CI or Azure DevOps Pipelines, AWS CodeDeploy is not longer necessary even for AWS-based projects.

name: Gulp
description:
Gulp is an open-source JavaScript toolkit by Fractal Innovations and the open source community at GitHub, used as a streaming build system in front-end web development. It is a task runner built on Node.js and npm, used for automation of time-consuming and repetitive tasks involved in web development. 
Will be used for non-bundling tasks.

name: Wordpress
description: Wordpress is extremely efficient for building simple content management platforms or corporate websites, so it looks like it will be a long-time presence in our portfolio. However, it will only be used by the digital experience team.

name: RabbitMQ
description: RabbitMQ's excellent support for queues and pub/sub make it a good candidate for projects requiring advanced messaging features. For projects running on Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure we highly encourage our teams to first look at the messaging services offered by the respective cloud platforms, but for AWS or on-prem based workloads RabbitMQ can be the first choice.

name: PostgreSQL
description: PostgreSQL's excellent support for geospatial and JSON data, as well as the ability to horizontally scale the database through mature and fully automated extensions such as Citus make PostgreSQL a great candidate for the primary data source role in our projects.

name: Vagrant
description: All new projects started after Q4 2019 will be using Docker for the local development environment, so Vagrant will be completely retired.

name: Drupal 8
description: We decided to stop using Drupal 8, as the developer experience was incompatible with our current team. Furthermore, a lot of projects required simple suite-building, with little or no coding involved, which basically dillutes our competitive advantage.

name: PrestaShop
description: As our experience with PrestaShop is limited and projects based on the technology are sparse, we decided to give up on it.

name: Magento 1.x
description: We have switched to Magento 2. All new projects will be based on the new versions, while existing projects will have to be upgrade as soon as possible.

name: ASP.NET Core 6
description: ASP.NET Core's portability, containerization support and developer experience make it the most loved back-end web framework according to Stack Overflow's Developer Survey 2022. Going forward, we will try to both start new projects on, as well as upgrade existing projects to ASP.NET Core 6.

name: React Admin
description: React Admin is a React-based framework for building customizable admin panesl. It provides ready-to-use components for common tasks, abstracting away CRUD operations, form validation, and UI customization. This ensures a consistent user experience across different backend technologies. Its high customizability allows for a uniform look and feel across applications, regardless of specific requirements.

name: Next.JS
description: Next.JS promises to deliver a more pleasant and efficient developer experience for front-end heavy applications requiring server-side rendering. We will test the framework on a customer project to validate its value proposition, but at first glance it does seem like it would be a major upgrade compared to our existing alternatives.

name: LangChain
description: LangChain is an open-source framework designed to simplify and standardize the creation of end-to-end generative AI applications by integrating with a multitude of large language models (LLMs), vector databases and content sources. It is a promising technology that could significantly reduce the time and effort required to build AI applications and our experience with it so far has been quite positive, but we need to further test it in additional real-world scenarios before making a decision.

name: ASP.NET MVC
description: We'll be switching to ASP.NET Core/5 starting with September 2021, as it's a technology that provides significantly better developer experience, as well as compatibility with containerization technologies.

name: Python
description: Given the limited knowledge we have, as well as the difficulty experienced in finding new colleagues or customers on this technology, we will scale back our efforts and instead focus on Node.JS as the third back-end web development language in the company.

name: ASP.NET Core 5
description: ASP.NET Core 5 reached end of support in May 2022, meaning all projects using it or any other previous versions of the framework should upgrade to version 6 as soon as possible.
